TopicTitle: The Dunatian, Playable Save File (Like a Scenario)

Articles.Content: I'll give it a go, and see where we end up, probably keep the weather stations, if I was sending stuff to mars the cargo modules would be buried and used as storage and living quarters, no waste, but that does mean sending earth moving equipment, which might negate any saving.
Has anyone here actually seen the movie yet?

there is a finite limit to the number of parts in physics range before it gets pretty slow
Yeah, I see what you mean..

Awesome job you've done on the DDV debris.. a pity I had to remove it to get a reasonable framerate.. with my crappy old 1.73GHz Core 2 Duo laptop, each single step my Kerbal made to get to the rover took 12 seconds! I terminated the 5 items of debris, and it was back to my usual about 3 seconds.

The real bummer is, the black-screen Kraken got me while I was only halfway to the RTG pickup.
i want to swear badly, was it it with the black screens

Has anyone here actually seen the movie yet?

On my way out the door to see it now!

They altered a few things that surprised me, but still less than is usual in book adaptions. Overall, I very much enjoyed it. Definitely good value.

Heh.. you should try it on a low-end machine..

I really do think some part-welding might be the way to go here.. turn all that debris around the site into single pieces, as much as possible. Some reading suggests that while the mod currently has some issues for flying craft (not game-killers, but you need to be careful about what you do and don't weld), for items that are just intended to be used as scenery, it should work just fine.

[1.0.4] UbioZur Welding Ltd. Continued 2.2.0 (2015-08-27)

There's a good youtube tutorial available for it, too.

I had some free time to play and got a bit done, did some testing, how do we feel about 4 wheel rovers? and utes? dropped 30 parts from rover 1 down to 86 parts and rover 2 is 90 parts, probably saves 70 parts, dropped the radio tower from 42 to 7 parts and the hab from 150 odd down to 69. All up i placed the bits again this time with a completely unmodded install except for hyperedit and I was getting 30FPS (see in the screenshot below) with everything in view, compared to not more than 10fps before. I have uploaded the save file again, but not changed the craft yet, I am waiting for Majorjims craft and to see what you think of the radio tower (it was meant to be damagesd yes?)

Just watched The Martian and now I can say how awesome the Hermes is, how cute Sojourner is and how much the food tastes like potatoes, have you made the MAV yet? I liked that.

What about the resupplier?

I can take interior and exterior stuff out of the hab and remove the solar farm dock

Well, it probably won't be necessary for you to mess with the Hab.. I've done it for you. I've had a fun and productive day learning about part welding and its' limitations. I wasn't able to do some of what I wanted, but made good progress overall.

The Duna Descent Vehicle, I reduced to the way it appears on Duna, since it doesn't need the fairing etc.. I turned the whole thing into a single part, down from the original 23 parts.

The Comms Tower you already know about.. a reduction of 34 parts.

The Hab gave me some trouble.. I was hoping to be able to lose another 20 or so parts by welding the underlying frame and the frame of the Solar Array, but even with the 'special' parts stripped off, those bits just would not weld correctly.. the part .cfg files were full of NaN, and they wouldn't display. However, I was able to turn the entire interior of the Hab into a single part, and rebuild the rest of the Hab around it, so that it looks and functions exactly the same as before, but instead of being 132 parts, its' now just 73 parts!

All told, those three items result in a combined reduction of 115 parts.

The part-reduced craft can be downloaded here.

I would have done the debris from the Ares 3 Duna Ascent Vehicle as well, but I'm having some trouble getting the welded parts re-attached to the core ship, so they can be dumped on the ground realistically.. if I can get that sorted out, it will result in another 40-45 less parts onsite.
